page.title: 03Sandbeck Hall
page.content: {Lord Scarbrough}owns the hall.It was built in the 1920's over the site of a large house.The property was designed by{James Paine}and built in magnesium limestone.This was quarried nearby. Sulpher dioxide from Sheffield and Rotherham dissolves the stone.As the building is a grade 1 listed building, the owner has a legal obligation to keep the outside wall maintained.In April 1985 urns,made of fibre glass, were placed on the balustrade.They are a copy of Paine's original engraving. {Inside,}the largest room has an 18th century ceiling.It was redecorated 5 years ago.The 8 spare bedrooms are used annually by up to 130 guests.Lord Scarbrough{employs,}for the hall,a butler,a cook,4 daily helpers,a full time and a part_time gardener.Before the last World War staff for the hall numbered 29.
